question: Consider the structure of the amino acid isoleucine. <image 1>  How many optical isomers does isoleucine have?
description: The image depicts the chemical structure of the amino acid isoleucine. The structure shows a central carbon atom (C) bonded to four different groups: a carboxylate group (COO⁻), an ammonium group (NH₃⁺), a hydrogen atom (H), and a side chain consisting of two methyl groups (CH₃) and one methylene group (CH₂). The side chain is branched, with one methyl group attached directly to the central carbon and the other methyl group attached to the methylene group. This branching creates a chiral center at the central carbon atom, which is characteristic of most amino acids.
